arm_group.description: 13C inulin combined with an inulin load are administered orally
An inulin load is administered orally

brief_summary.textblock:
In this placebo controlled, double-blind, randomized crossover study the investigators will
      investigate in overweight/obese healthy male volunteers whether inulin administration will
      increase intestinal SCFA production, thereby investigating whether this will lead to acute
      metabolic effects.

detailed_description.textblock:
Gut microbiota is being increasingly recognized as an important factor in fat distribution,
      insulin sensitivity and glucose and lipid metabolism. Accordingly, the intestinal microbiota
      could play an important role in the development of obesity and type 2 diabetes mellitus. The
      role of gut-derived short-chain fatty acids (SCFA), the formation of which is enhanced by
      microbial fermentation of fibre, is still controversial. At the present time, our
      understanding of the effects of SCFA on human metabolism (in gut or systemically) is still
      limited. The investigators hypothesize that the ingested prebiotic inulin is fermented into
      SCFA and these SCFA have metabolic effects.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Overweight, obese men

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  athletes

          -  diabetes mellitus

clinical_study.official_title: SCFA Production and Their Metabolic Effects After Inulin Ingestion

oversight_info.authority: Netherlands: The Central Committee on Research Involving Human Subjects (CCMO)

primary_outcome.description: Fat oxidation and energy expenditure are measured after inulin ingestion

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Insulin, GLP-1, PYY, FIAF will be measured in plasma after inulin ingestion
secondary_outcome.measure: Hormones that influence substrate and energy metabolism

secondary_outcome.description: LBP, TNF-α, IL-6, IL-1 will be measured in plasma after inulin ingestion
Glucose, FFA, TG will be measured in plasma after inulin ingestion
Visual Analogue Scale for hunger and appetite are completed after inulin ingestion
SCFA content (acetate, butyrate and propionate, unlabeled and 13C-labeled) are measured after inulin ingestion in plasma, faeces, evtl muscle and adipose tissue
In breath samples 13CO2 will be measured after inulin ingestion
Adipose tissue and muscle gene/protein expression for inflammatory markers will be measured after inulin ingestion
secondary_outcome.measure: Adipose tissue and muscle gene/protein expression for inflammatory markers

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
